revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} {{Use British English|date=September 2014}} [[Image:uncleWillyhead&shoulders.jpg|thumb|William Fane de Salis]] '''William Andreas Salius Fane de Salis''' (27 October 1812 – 3 August 1896) was a businessman, colonialist, and barrister. [[Image:uncleWillyYoungerStanding.jpg|150px|thumb|William aged 49 by [[Camille Silvy]], 1861.]] [[File:Tea in the conservatory, Teffont Evias, Wiltshire, showing the back of the head of William Fane de Salis.jpg|thumbnail|Tea in the conservatory at Teffont, Wiltshire, showing the back of the head of W. F. de Salis.]] [[File:Exposition Universelle de 1867 W. Fane De Salis.jpg|thumb|William's was the commissioner of [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria's]] stand at the [[International Exposition (1867)|Paris 1867 exhibition]].]] De Salis was the third son of [[Jerome, 4th Count de Salis-Soglio]] (d. 1836), by his third wife, Henrietta Foster (d. 1856).[[Burke's Landed Gentry]], edited by [[Kenneth Peter Townend (1921–2001)|Peter Townend]], eighteenth edition, volume one, London, [[Burke's Peerage]], 1965, (pages 251-253). [[Peter, 5th Count de Salis-Soglio|Peter John Fane, Count de Salis]] was an elder half-brother. [[William Stawell|William Foster Stawell]] was a first cousin, and the poet [[John Warren, 3rd Baron de Tabley|Lord De Tabley]] was a nephew. [[Thomas-Chaloner Bisse-Challoner (1788-1872)|Colonel Bisse-Challoner]] was a brother-in-law. [[Rodolphus Johannes Leslie Hibernicus de Salis (general)|General Rodolph de Salis]] was an elder brother and [[Rev. Count Henry Jerome Augustine Fane de Salis|the Rev. Henry Jerome de Salis]] was his youngest brother and [[Rodolph Fane De Salis|Rodolph]], [[Cecil Fane De Salis|Cecil]] and [[Charles de Salis (bishop)|Charles]] were nephews.''NOTES OF PAST DAYS'', By Cecil and Rachel De Salis, Henley-on-Thames, 1939. (Printed by Higgs & Co., Caxton Works). Born in [[St. Marylebone]], Westminster, brought up in [[County Louth]] he was educated at Eton (1824–27); [[Heidelberg University]] (1828–29); and [[Oriel College, Oxford]] (1830–1834, Classics, 4th class). He was called to the Bar, 30 January 1836; and was at 3 Brick Court, [[Inner Temple]], by 1840. He was appointed a [[Electoral registration in the United Kingdom#Registration process from 1832|revising barrister]] for [[Northamptonshire]] (1839), [[Nottingham]] and [[East Retford (UK Parliament constituency)|East Retford]]. ==Professional life== Fane de Salis visited Australia in 1842, 1844 and 1848 to pursue business opportunities in the Australian wool and other industries, then rapidly expanding. His younger brother [[Cuppacumbalong Homestead|Leopold Fabius Fane de Salis]] had migrated there in 1840. William became, with John Thacker, a partner in Thacker & Co, [[Jardine Matheson]]’s affiliated house in Sydney, but resigned from 1 July 1847. By 1848 he owned with [[Robert Towns]] a 345-ton [[barque]], the ''Statesman''.[http://mariners.records.nsw.gov.au/1847/05/023sta.htm A trace of the barque.] This they sold, March 1854, for $16,500, she having had an accident 'on her passage up to China from Sydney' trading sandalwood, tea pines... On his return to England de Salis joined the [[Grand Junction Canal]] Co in 1850 and held the following appointments: * Directorship of the [[Union Bank of Australia]]; * Director of the [[Australian Agricultural Company]] (AAco) and its offshoot the [[Peel River (New South Wales)|Peel River]] Land and Mineral Co Ltd; * Director of [[The Marine and General Mutual Life Assurance Society]]; * Director and later chairman of the [[Peninsular & Oriental Steam Navigation Company]]. He was a director between 1851–1895 and was elected chairman in 1878-1881; * Deputy-chairman then chairman of the [[Australia and New Zealand Banking Group|London Chartered Bank of Australia]] from 1852 to 1874/80. ==Personal life== [[Image:William&EmilyFaneDeSalis.jpg|thumb|right|125px|Detail of a drawing entitled ''Evenings at Home'', depicting De Salis and his wife, c. 1870.]] [[Image:EmilyMayne,MrsWilliamDeSalis.jpg|thumb|125px|Emily Mayne de Salis.]] [[File:William Fane De Salis by Ouless.jpg|thumb|125px|Part of portrait by [[Walter William Ouless|Ouless]] presented by the shareholders of the London Chartered Bank of Australia in 1880.]] [[File:Pond & hedge at Dawley Court, Goulds Green, Hillingdon, Middlesex, 1893, with William Andrew Fane De Salis in a bath chair.jpg|thumbnail|William Fane de Salis in a [[Bath chair]] by the pond at Dawley Court, Goulds Green, 1893.]] In the early 1850s Fane de Salis lived between the Jerusalem Coffee House; Dawley Lodge (near Hillingdon); 1 Upper Belgrave Street; 24 Wilton Street, and 107 Eaton Square. From the late 1850s he lived at Dawley Court, near [[Hillingdon]], and [[Harlington, London|Harlington]], Uxbridge, Middlesex and [[Teffont Evias|Teffont Manor]], Teffont Evias, Wiltshire, home of his wife Emily Harriet (d 24 July 1896), eldest daughter of John Thomas Mayne, whom he married on 12 March 1859. Fane de Salis was a Fellow of the [[Geological Society]] and of the [[Royal Geographical Society]], JP for Middlesex, (1868), with his wife he was Lord of the Manor and Patron of the Living of Teffont, and JP for Wiltshire. With [[John Derby Allcroft|J. D. Allcroft]] he co-founded the [[Harlington, Harmondsworth and Cranford Cottage Hospital]] in 1884. He left Dawley Court to his youngest brother's second son, Sir [[Cecil Fane De Salis]], KCB, one of whose younger brothers was [[Charles Fane de Salis]]. At his death Fane de Salis left effects valued at £147,382 6s 7d. His nephew [[Rodolph Fane De Salis|Rodolph]] was executor. His wife Emily had died only ten days earlier, leaving £1,930.[https://probatesearch.service.gov.uk Probate Office wills search], 1896, under "De Salis" [[William Fane De Salis (admiral)|Admiral Sir William Fane de Salis]], KBE, was another nephew. ==Works== [[File:Victoria Island of Hong Kong, lithograph by William Fane de Salis (1812-1896).jpg|thumbnail|Victoria Island of Hong Kong, lithograph by William Fane De Salis.]] * ''Reminiscences of Travel in China and India in 1848'' (1892; private circulation); * ''Introductory Remarks to a Residence in Australia, And To Travels in China And India'' (a short pamphlet); * ''Original Poems with Translations from the German of [[Schiller]]'' (private circulation). {{short description|Israeli lawyer (b. 1968)}} {{copy edit|date=November 2018}}
'''Yaron Kanner''' is an Israeli social entrepreneur and lawyer, director of the [https://merkazhinam.wixsite.com/hinam-center-wix-en Hinam Center] for Social Tolerance.
== Biography == Yaron Kanner was born in Tel Aviv in 1968. He studied at the Netiv Meir High School in Jerusalem and later at Yeshivat Ateret Cohanim (today known as Yeshivat Ateret Yerushalayim). He served in the "Shimshon" undercover unit in the IDF during the First Intifada.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.israelhayom.co.il/article/533129|title=ירון קנר: "אין תחליף להיכרות עם האחר" {{!}} ישראל היום|work=ישראל היום|access-date=2018-09-15|language=he}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mnews.co.il/stories/5113|title="יגאל עמיר הביט בי בחשדנות ושאל: "מי אתה? מאיפה אתה בא?"|website=www.mnews.co.il|access-date=2018-09-15}}</ref> In the 1990s, he served as a correspondent for Israel Radio's Channel 2 network and, among others, was the first reporter to broadcast live on Israel Radio that shots were fired at then-prime minister Yitzhak Rabin. Later he broadcast a documentary program on television, mainly during "The Diary" on the IBA’s First Channel. He was also a reporter for Yedioth Ahronoth, writing for the "7 Days" supplement.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mnews.co.il/stories/5113|title="יגאל עמיר הביט בי בחשדנות ושאל: "מי אתה? מאיפה אתה בא?"|website=www.mnews.co.il|access-date=2018-09-15}}</ref>
After working as a journalist, he began to study social law. As a lawyer, he served as the director of the Legal Department of the Tebeka Association and led legal battles against the private and institutional discrimination of members of the Ethiopian community. Among others, he was one of the leaders of the legal struggle in the affair of the "Nezer Etzion" school in Petach Tikvah, whose students (except one) were members of the Ethiopian community.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://news.walla.co.il/item/1856479|title=דעה: סגירת בית הספר נר עציון רצף של טעויות - וואלה! חדשות|work=וואלה! חדשות|access-date=2018-09-15|language=he-IL}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.globes.co.il/news/article.aspx?did=1000723886#utm_source=social&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=facebook|title=עו"ד ירון קנר מונה למנכ"ל החדש של רדיו קול ברמה|last=ברק|first=רועי|website=גלובס|language=he|access-date=2018-09-15|date=2012-02-12}}</ref>
In 2012-2013 he served as CEO of the Kol BaRama radio station, as director-general of Kol Barama, he led a respectful discourse towards all sectors, even if their views were contrary to the nature of the stationand.[https://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4265735,00.html]<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.globes.co.il/news/article.aspx?did=1000723886#utm_source=social&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=facebook|title=עו"ד ירון קנר מונה למנכ"ל החדש של רדיו קול ברמה|last=ברק|first=רועי|website=גלובס|language=he|access-date=2018-09-15|date=2012-02-12}}</ref> Then as director of Panim – the Association of Israeli Jewish Organizations.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://jewishfed.org/2014/03/03/gvanim-10-1|title=Jewish Pluralism, Bay Area Style: Israeli Gvanim Fellows Travel to the Bay for Cultural Exchange|work=Jewish Community Federation|access-date=2018-07-04|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.pressreader.com/israel/the-jerusalem-post/20140804/281689727955166|title=PressReader.com - Connecting People Through News|website=www.pressreader.com|access-date=2018-09-01}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.makorrishon.co.il/nrg/online/11/ART2/560/986.html|title=20 שנה אחרי טבח גולדשטיין: איך נמנע את הרצח הבא?|website=NRG|access-date=2018-09-15}}</ref> In addition, Kanner initiated his position as director general of Panim conferences dealing with the connection between groups and tribes in Israeli society, while trying to promote dialogue between the various groups.[https://modiinapp.com/en/page/1920/tisha-b-av-conference-show-with-shlomo-gronich-free] In 2016 founded the Hinam Center for Social Tolerance.
== As a Journalist == The investigative reports that Kanner published in Yedioth Ahronoth were characterized by an active approach, in which the journalist is not satisfied with presenting the evidence alone to prove the subject of his investigation, but is actively involved in the investigation itself. This way Kanner tried to produce articles that benefitted from high credibility.
About two months before the assassination of then Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin, Kanner entered the Eyal organization, where Yigal Amir was a member. During his recruitment to the organization, Avishai Raviv visited his home, and after that Kanner held meetings with Yigal Amir and Hagai Amir in Hebron and was due to join the organization as a weapons instructor. The purpose of the debriefing was to examine the intentions of the organization and its members, in light of their public threats against Yitzhak Rabin. The investigative report, which was planned to continue for several months, was interrupted by Rabin's assassination. Kanner immediately published a series of articles about his meetings with Yigal Amir and the other members of the organization.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://m.news1.co.il/ArticlePage.aspx%3fdocid%3d106912%26subjectid%3d3%26TransID%3d0%26AfterAdd%3d1|title=לא חשבתי אחרת|access-date=2018-09-15}}</ref>
Kanner served, at the time, as a reporter for the Israel Radio network. On November 4, 1995, he was sent by the radio network to cover the "Yes to Peace, No to Violence" rally held at Malkhei Yisrael Square (today Rabin Square in Tel Aviv). As stated, Kanner was the first reporter to report that shots were fired at Yitzhak Rabin as he descended the back stairs of the stage toward his car.<ref>{{Cite web|last=yaron kanner|title=רצח רבין - הדיווח הראשון|date=2008-08-13|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=amybp7tRGnA&feature=youtu.be|access-date=2018-09-15}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.10.tv/documentary/132387|title=לא חשבתי שהוא יצחק - הסרט המלא|website=ערוץ עשר|language=he|access-date=2018-09-15}}</ref>
In 1996, Kanner conducted an investigation into forced psychiatric hospitalization, in which he managed to bring about his own hospitalization at the [http://www.hamichlol.org.il/%D7%94%D7%9E%D7%A8%D7%9B%D7%96_%D7%94%D7%A8%D7%A4%D7%95%D7%90%D7%99_%D7%9C%D7%91%D7%A8%D7%99%D7%90%D7%95%D7%AA_%D7%94%D7%A0%D7%A4%D7%A9_%D7%90%D7%91%D7%A8%D7%91%D7%A0%D7%90%D7%9C Abarbanel Psychiatric Hospital] for four days, following fictitious letters of complaint he sent to the Tel Aviv District Psychiatrist. In this, Kanner proved that the district psychiatrist was not conducting the necessary tests before ordering forced hospitalization. Following a series of articles published on the subject, an investigation committee was set up by the Ministry of Health, and some of the legal requirements relating to forced hospitalization were changed.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://shemtov1.com/lor/tag/%D7%99%D7%A8%D7%95%D7%9F-%D7%A7%D7%A0%D7%A8-%D7%A1%D7%99%D7%95%D7%98-%D7%91%D7%9E%D7%97%D7%9C%D7%A7%D7%94-5-%D7%91%D7%99%D7%AA-%D7%97%D7%95%D7%9C%D7%99%D7%9D-%D7%90%D7%91%D7%A8%D7%91%D7%A0%D7%9C/|title=ירון קנר סיוט במחלקה 5 בית חולים אברבנל – לורי שם טוב מידעו"ס ומשפטפטת|website=shemtov1.com|language=he-IL|access-date=2018-09-15}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://isra-health.blogspot.com/2014/12/Yaron-Kaner.html|title=פסיכיאטריה: משוגע בעל כורחו - ירון קנר - ידיעות אחרונות - 16.8.1996|website=פסיכיאטריה|access-date=2018-09-15}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://social2017blog.wordpress.com/2014/12/11/%D7%99%D7%A8%D7%95%D7%9F-%D7%A7%D7%A0%D7%A8-%D7%90%D7%A9%D7%A4%D7%96-%D7%90%D7%AA-%D7%A2%D7%A6%D7%9E%D7%95-%D7%91%D7%90%D7%91%D7%A8%D7%91%D7%A0%D7%90%D7%9C-%D7%9B%D7%93%D7%99-%D7%9C%D7%91%D7%93/amp/|title=ירון קנר אשפז את עצמו ב'אברבנאל' כדי לבדוק מה קורה בחדרי החדרים של המוסד|date=2014-12-11|work=חדשות רווחה|access-date=2018-09-15|language=he-IL}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://social2017blog.wordpress.com/2014/12/11/%D7%A1%D7%99%D7%95%D7%98-%D7%91%D7%9E%D7%97%D7%9C%D7%A7%D7%94-5-%D7%99%D7%A8%D7%95%D7%9F-%D7%A7%D7%A0%D7%A8-7-%D7%99%D7%9E%D7%99%D7%9D-%D7%99%D7%93%D7%99%D7%A2%D7%95%D7%AA-%D7%90%D7%97%D7%A8/amp/|title=סיוט במחלקה 5 – ירון קנר – 7 ימים – ידיעות אחרונות – 23.08.1996|date=2014-12-11|work=חדשות רווחה|access-date=2018-09-15|language=he-IL}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://alaxon.co.il/article/%D7%A6%D7%99%D7%A4%D7%95%D7%A8-%D7%94%D7%A0%D7%A4%D7%A9-%D7%A9%D7%95%D7%91-%D7%9B%D7%9C%D7%95%D7%90%D7%94/|title=ציפור הנפש שוב כלואה – אלכסון|website=alaxon.co.il|language=he-IL|access-date=2018-09-15|date=2017-09-04}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://sites.google.com/site/mlbdebate1/home/4/yaron-kenrer|title=ירון קנר - MLB Debate|website=sites.google.com|access-date=2018-09-15}}</ref>
His journalistic approach aroused controversy over the extent of the journalist's proper involvement in the subject of his investigation, as well as ethical questions related to the legitimacy of impersonation and misrepresentation of the authorities in order to expose information of public importance.
== In the World of Tolerance == Kanner advocates promoting a tolerant society through a long and meaningful acquaintance with the other. The Hinam Center that he founded applies this approach through in-depth journeys into the Israeli society where participants live "the lives of others" and spend extended periods of time in various communities in Israeli society (ultra-Orthodox, Arabs, settlers, Ethiopians, etc.).<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://blogs.timesofisrael.com/an-alternative-schedule-for-vp-pence/|title=An alternative schedule for VP Pence|access-date=2018-09-01|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.jewishlinknj.com/community-news/bergen/25129-yi-of-teaneck-hosts-mk-glick-hinam-s-kanner|title=YI of Teaneck Hosts MK Glick, Hinam’s Kanner|last=Staff|first=JLNJ|access-date=2018-09-01|language=en-gb}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://jewishfed.org/2014/03/03/gvanim-10-1|title=Jewish Pluralism, Bay Area Style: Israeli Gvanim Fellows Travel to the Bay for Cultural Exchange|work=Jewish Community Federation|access-date=2018-09-01|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.israelhayom.com/2018/09/07/a-lesson-in-co-existence/?platform=hootsuite|title=A lesson in co-existence - Israel Hayom|date=2018-09-07|work=Israel Hayom|access-date=2018-09-10|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.israelhayom.co.il/article/533129|title=ירון קנר: "אין תחליף להיכרות עם האחר" {{!}} ישראל היום|work=ישראל היום|access-date=2018-09-15|language=he}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.ynet.co.il/articles/0,7340,L-5013783,00.html|title=הינם כאן|last=חבוט|first=אילנית סולומונוביץ'|date=2017-08-09|work=Ynet|access-date=2018-09-15|language=he}}</ref>
In 2016, President Reuven Rivlin met members of one of the Hinam Center’s groups after they completeda four-month journey between communities in Israel. The President noted that this is the way to truly recognize Israeli society in all its forms.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Ultra-Orthodox-Arab-Ethiopian-and-settler-youth-unite-under-one-roof-454184|title=Ultra-Orthodox, Arab, Ethiopian, and settler youth unite under one roof|work=The Jerusalem Post {{!}} JPost.com|access-date=2018-07-04}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.jfedgmw.org/access/access-federation-91217/achi-israeli-update|title=Achi Israeli Update {{!}} Jewish Federation of Greater MetroWest NJ|website=www.jfedgmw.org|language=en-US|access-date=2018-09-01}}</ref>

[[Eva Gabor]] (sister) }} [[File:Zsa-Zsa 1936.jpg|thumb|Zsa Zsa Gabor in 1936]] '''Zsa Zsa Gabor''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|ʒ|ɑː|ʒ|ɑː|_|ˈ|g|ɑː|b|ɔr|,_|-|g|ə|ˈ|b|ɔr}} {{respell|ZHAH|zhah|_|GAH|bor|,_-|gə|BOR}}; {{IPA-hu|ˈʒɒʒɒ ˈɡaːbor|lang}}; born '''Sári Gábor''' {{IPA-hu|ˈʃaːri ˈɡaːbor|}}; February 6, 1917 – December 18, 2016) was a [[Hungarian Americans|Hungarian-American]] actress and socialite. Her sisters were actresses [[Eva Gabor|Eva]] and [[Magda Gabor]]. Gabor began her stage career in [[Vienna]] and was crowned [[Miss Hungary]] in 1936.Hischak, Thomas S. ''The Oxford Companion to the American Musical: Theatre, Film, and Television'', New York: Oxford University Press, 2008, p.271 She emigrated from [[Hungary]] to the United States in 1941. Becoming a sought-after actress with "European flair and style", she was considered to have a personality that "exuded charm and grace".Barris, George. ''Barris Cars of the Stars'', MBI Publishing (2008), p. 71 Her first film role was a supporting role in ''[[Lovely to Look At]]''. She later acted in ''[[We're Not Married!]]'' and played one of her few leading roles in the [[John Huston]]-directed film, ''[[Moulin Rouge (1952 film)|Moulin Rouge]]'' (1952). Huston would later describe her as a "creditable" actress.Huston, John. ''John Huton: Interviews'', Univ. Press of Mississippi (2001), p. 11 Outside her acting career, Gabor was known for her extravagant Hollywood lifestyle, her glamorous personality, and her many marriages. In total, Gabor had nine husbands, including hotel magnate [[Conrad Hilton]] and actor [[George Sanders]]. She once stated, "Men have always liked me and I have always liked men. But I like a mannish man, a man who knows how to talk to and treat a woman—not just a man with muscles.""Love Hints from Zsa Zsa", ''Life Magazine'', October 15, 1951 (cover story). ==Early life and ancestry== Zsa Zsa Gabor was born Sári Gábor on February 6, 1917{{cite web|title=The Secret Is Out: Zsa Zsa is 72|publisher=News Archive|date=November 3, 1989|url=http://www.apnewsarchive.com/1989/The-Secret-Is-Out-Zsa-Zsa-is-72/id-7137f427bd21050bce56707127104950|accessdate=February 14, 2014}} in [[Budapest]], [[Lands of the Crown of Saint Stephen|Hungary]], then part of the [[Austria-Hungary|Austro-Hungarian Empire]]. The middle of three daughters, her parents were Vilmos, a soldier, and [[Jolie Gabor]] (née Janka Tilleman).{{cite web|url=http://www.filmreference.com/film/29/Zsa-Zsa-Gabor.html|title=Zsa Zsa Gabor profile at|publisher=Filmreference.com|accessdate=June 12, 2013}}Jolie Gabor's date of birth was September 30, 1896, although most sources cite September 29, but September 30 date and her name at birth as "Janka" not "Jansci" are supported by her birth certificate. Her parents were both of [[History of the Jews in Hungary|Jewish]] ancestry. While her mother escaped Hungary during the same time period of the Nazi occupation of Budapest, Gabor left the country in 1941, three years prior to the takeover.{{cite web |url=http://m.jpost.com/Not-Just-News/Trending-Now/Jewish-born-Hollywood-star-Zsa-Zsa-Gabor-dies-at-age-99-475820#article=6019RjVENTY3RjI3NTRBMUE3MDE5MDdFNzc4MzdDQzhERTQ= |title=Jewish-born Hollywood star Zsa Zsa Gabor dies at age 99 |publisher=Jerusalem Post |date=December 19, 2016 |accessdate=December 30, 2016}}[http://www.dw.com/en/auf-wiedersehen-darling-a-tribute-to-the-inimitable-zsa-zsa-gabor/a-36821518 "'Auf Wiedersehen, Darling': A tribute to the inimitable Zsa Zsa Gabor"], ''Deutsche Welle'' (DW), December 19, 2016Adams, Cindy. ''Jolie Gabor'', Mason/Charter Publ. (1975), pp. 135–49{{cite web|url=https://www.jewishtampa.com/jews-in-the-news/jews-in-the-news-bonni-tischler-steven-spielberg-vilmos-gabor|title=Jews in the News: Bonni Tischler, Steven Spielberg and Vilmos Gabor - Tampa Jewish Federation|publisher=jewishtampa.com|accessdate=July 27, 2016}}{{cite web|last=Bennetts|first=Leslie|url=http://www.vanityfair.com/culture/features/2007/10/zsazsa200710|title=It's a Mad, Mad, Zsa Zsa World|work=Vanity Fair|date=September 6, 2007|accessdate=June 12, 2013}} Gabor's elder sister, [[Magda Gabor|Magda]], eventually became an American socialite and her younger sister, [[Eva Gabor|Eva]], became an American actress and businesswoman. The Gabor sisters were first cousins of Annette Lantos, wife of California Congressman [[Tom Lantos]] (D-CA).{{cite web|url=http://www.raoulwallenberg.net/press/2007/holocaust-helped-shape-lantos|title=Holocaust helped shape Lantos' path|work=raoulwallenberg.net|accessdate=December 21, 2016}} ==Career== According to Gabor, she was discovered by operatic tenor [[Richard Tauber]] on a trip to [[Vienna]] in 1934, following her time as a student at a [[Switzerland|Swiss]] boarding school. Tauber invited Gabor to sing the [[soubrette]] role in his new [[operetta]], ''Der singende Traum'' (''The Singing Dream''), at the [[Theater an der Wien]]. This would mark her first stage appearance. In 1936, she was crowned Miss Hungary.[https://www.nytimes.com/2016/12/18/movies/zsa-zsa-gabor-often-married-actress-known-for-glamour-dies.html "Zsa Zsa Gabor, Often-Married Actress Known for Glamour, Dies at 99"], ''The New York Times'', December 18, 2016. [[File:Zsa Zsa Gabor - Ray - 1953.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Dancing with director [[Nicholas Ray]] (1953)]] In 1944, she co-wrote a novel with writer Victoria Wolf entitled ''Every Man For Himself''. According to Gabor, the fictional story was derived, in a small part, from Gabor's life experiences. The book was subsequently bought by an American magazine.{{cite web|url=https://newspaperarchive.com/us/iowa/waterloo/waterloo-daily-courier/1944/02-23/page-8?tag=zsa+zsa+hilton&rtserp=tags/?pep=zsa-zsa-hilton|title=Zsa Zsa Hilton|publisher=Waterloo Daily Courier|date=February 23, 1944|accessdate=May 28, 2016|author=Parsons, Louella|page=8}} In 1949, Gabor declined an offer to play the leading role in a film version of the classic book ''[[Lady Chatterley's Lover]]''. According to an article written the Cedar Rapids Gazette in 1949, she turned down the role of Lady Chatterley due to the story's controversial theme.{{cite web|url=https://newspaperarchive.com/us/iowa/cedar-rapids/cedar-rapids-gazette/1949/11-28/page-22?tag=zsa+zsa+gabor&rtserp=tags/?pep=zsa-zsa-gabor&ndt=by&py=1940&pey=1949|title=Snapshots of Hollywood|publisher=Cedar Rapids Gazette|date=November 28, 1949|accessdate=May 28, 2016|author=Parsons, Louella|page=22}} Her more serious film acting credits include ''[[Moulin Rouge (1952 film)|Moulin Rouge]]'', ''[[Lovely to Look At]]'' and ''[[We're Not Married!]]'', all from 1952, and 1953’s ''[[Lili]]''. In 1958, she ran the gamut of moviemaking, from ''[[Touch of Evil]]'' (1958) to the camp oddity ''[[Queen of Outer Space]]'' (1958). Later, she appeared in such films as ''[[Won Ton Ton, the Dog Who Saved Hollywood]]'' (1976) and ''[[Frankenstein's Great Aunt Tillie]]'' (1984). She did cameos for ''[[A Nightmare on Elm Street 3: Dream Warriors]]'' (1987), ''[[The Beverly Hillbillies (film)|The Beverly Hillbillies]]'' (1993) and ''A Very Brady Sequel'' (1996) and voiced a character in the animated ''[[Happily Ever After (1993 film)|Happily Ever After]]'' (1990).{{Citation needed|date=November 2017}} She was also a regular guest on television shows, appearing with [[Milton Berle]],{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gobpKponE_c|title=Zsa Zsa Gabor & Denise Darcel with Milton Berle (1956)|first=|last=swan2612|date=June 3, 2013|accessdate=December 21, 2016|via=YouTube}} [[Jack Paar]], [[Johnny Carson]], [[Howard Stern]],{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fPbL_P7R9EE |title=Howard Stern(Johnny Carson) - Zsa Zsa Gabor |first= |last=firstcowtails |date=November 27, 2010 |publisher= |accessdate=December 21, 2016 |via=YouTube}} [[David Frost]], [[Arsenio Hall]], [[Phil Donahue]],{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wj5sOfWZbtM|title=Zsa Zsa Gabor 1991 Phil Donahue|first=|last=Drew David|date=March 11, 2016|accessdate=December 21, 2016|via=YouTube}} and [[Joan Rivers]].{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R-S73z0aMfQ|title=Zsa Zsa Gabor on The Joan Rivers Show|first=|last=William French|date=July 14, 2011|accessdate=December 21, 2016|via=YouTube}} She was a guest on the [[Bob Hope]] specials,{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cOPEZv8sQNc;t=32m24s |title=Bob Hope Special January 11, 1961 |first= |last=20th Century Vision |date=July 30, 2014 |publisher= |accessdate=December 21, 2016 |via=YouTube}} the [[Dean Martin]] Roasts, ''[[Hollywood Squares]]'', ''[[Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In]]'', and ''[[It's Garry Shandling's Show]]''.[http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/tv/la-et-st-zsa-zsa-gabor-appreciation-20161219-story.html "Zsa Zsa Gabor: An independent woman who elevated her fabulous self into the celebrity stratosphere"], ''Los Angeles Times'', December 19, 2016 In 1968, she appeared in the role of Minerva on an episode of ''[[Batman (TV series)|Batman]]'', becoming the show's final "special guest villain" when it was cancelled soon after. She appeared on the [[Late Night with David Letterman|''Late Night'']] show where she told host [[David Letterman]] about her [[blind date]] with [[Henry Kissinger]], which was arranged by [[Richard Nixon]].[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4AKD7lKn-jQ;t=3m58s Zsa Zsa Gabor on Late Night, February 11, 1987], Author [[Gerold Frank]], who helped Gabor write her autobiography in 1960, described his impressions of her:
Zsa Zsa is unique. She's a woman from the court of [[Louis XV of France|Louis XV]] who has somehow managed to live in the 20th century, undamaged by the PTA ... She says she wants to be all the [[Madame de Pompadour|Pompadours]] and [[Madame du Barry|Du Barrys]] of history rolled into one, but she also says, "I always goof. I pay all my own bills. ... I want to choose the man. I do not permit men to choose me.""Ghost", ''Life Magazine'', June 29, 1959, pp 129–39
In his autobiography, television host [[Merv Griffin]], who was known to spend time with Gabor's younger sister Eva socially, wrote of the Gabor sisters' initial presence in New York and Hollywood: "All these years later, it's hard to describe the phenomenon of the three glamorous Gabor girls and their ubiquitous mother. They burst onto the [[Society reporting|society pages]] and into the gossip columns so suddenly, and with such force, it was as if they'd been dropped out of the sky."Griffin, Merv. ''Merv: Making the Good Life Last'', Simon & Schuster (2003), pg. 179; {{ISBN|0743456963}} In 1973 she was the guest roastee on the ''[[The Dean Martin Celebrity Roast|Dean Martin Roast]]'' show,{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7EWh1qCGy5c|title=Zsa Zsa Gabor on Dean Martin Roast|first=|last=AmericaSings|date=December 18, 2016|publisher=|accessdate=December 21, 2016|via=YouTube}} and in 1998, film historian [[Neal Gabler]] called her kind of celebrity "The Zsa Zsa Factor".[http://www.cbsnews.com/news/zsa-zsa-gabor-legendary-actress-and-socialite-dead-at-99/ "Zsa Zsa Gabor, famed actress and socialite, dead at 99"], cbsnews.com, December 18, 2016. ==Personal life== [[File:550106-ZsaZsaGabor-DenverMuscularDystrophy.jpg|thumb|right|Gabor at the Denver Muscular Dystrophy TV Marathon, c. 1955]] Gabor was married nine times. She was divorced seven times, and one marriage was [[annulment|annulled]]. "All in all — I love being married", she wrote in her autobiography. "I love the companionship, I love cooking for a man (simple things like chicken soup and my special Dracula's goulash from Hungary), and spending all my time with a man. Of course I love being in love — but it is marriage that really fulfills me. But not in every case." Her husbands, in chronological order, were: * [[Burhan Asaf Belge]] (May 17, 1935{{snd}}1941; divorced){{cite web|url=https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/3:1:S3HT-6143-C1W?mode=g&i=58&cc=1452460|title=Marriage entry, 17 May 1935 Budapest 11th district, 172/1935|publisher=}}Gabor, Zsa Zsa; Frank, Gerold. ''Zsa Zsa Gabor: My Story'', The World Publishing Company, 1960. * [[Conrad Hilton]] (April 10, 1942 – 1947; divorced)Feinberg, Alexander. "[https://query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9803EFDE123AE233A25756C0A9669D946693D6CF&legacy=true Bandit Gets $600,000 Gems in Raid on Penthouse Home: Mrs. Sari Hilton, Hotel Chain Owner's Wife, Reveals Hiding Place of Jewel Box After Intruder Threatens to Shoot Baby]", ''The New York Times'', October 5, 1947. "Conrad's decision to change my name from Zsa Zsa to Georgia symbolized everything my marriage to him would eventually become. My Hungarian roots were to be ripped out and my background ignored. ... I soon discovered that my marriage to Conrad meant the end of my freedom. My own needs were completely ignored: I belonged to Conrad." * [[George Sanders]] (April 2, 1949 – April 2, 1954; divorced){{cite web|url=http://classicmoviechat.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/zsa-zsa-gabor_32772875.jp_.jpeg|title=Photo of Zsa Zsa Gabor and husband George Sanders|publisher=}} * [[Herbert Hutner]] (November 5, 1962 – March 3, 1966; divorced)"[https://query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E06E4DD103DE033A05755C0A9679D946391D6CF&legacy=true Zsa Zsa Gabor Is Married Here to Corporation Head]", ''The New York Times'', November 6, 1962."[https://www.nytimes.com/2008/12/20/washington/20hutner.html Herbert L. Hutner, Arts Adviser, Is Dead at 99]", ''The New York Times'', December 19, 2008. "Herbert took away my will to work. With his kindness and generosity, he almost annihilated my drive. I have always been the kind of woman who could never be satisfied by money — only excitement and achievement."[http://www.foxnews.com/entertainment/2016/12/18/love-being-in-love-zsa-zsa-gabor-on-life-fame-and-marriage.html "'I love being in love': Zsa Zsa Gabor on life, fame and marriage"], ''Fox News'', December 18, 2016[http://f.tqn.com/y/marriage/1/S/3/W/103403975.jpg Photo of Zsa Gabor and husband Herbert Hutner] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160410142656/http://f.tqn.com/y/marriage/1/S/3/W/103403975.jpg |date=2016-04-10 }} * Joshua S. Wilson Company, 1989), p.177. * [[Frédéric Prinz von Anhalt]] (August 14, 1986 – December 18, 2016; her death) [[File:Zsa Zsa Gabor - premiere 1960.jpg|thumb|Gabor arriving at a movie premiere in 1962]] Gabor's divorces inspired her to make numerous quotable puns and innuendos about her marital (and extramarital) history. She commented: "I am a marvelous housekeeper: Every time I leave a man I keep his house."{{cite web|url=http://www.ovalbooks.com/xeno/Hungarians.html|title=Xenophobe's guide to the Hungarians|publisher=Ovalbooks.com|accessdate=August 13, 2010}} Gabor later claimed to have had a sexual encounter with her stepson, [[Conrad Hilton, Jr.|Nicky]]. In 1970, Gabor purchased a nearly 9,000-square-foot [[Hollywood Regency]]-style home in [[Bel Air, Los Angeles|Bel Air]], which once belonged to [[Elvis Presley]],{{Cite news|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/living/2436988/inside-zsa-zsa-gabors-opulent-26-room-mansion-that-was-once-home-to-elvis-presley/|title=Inside Zsa Zsa Gabor's opulent 26-room mansion that was once home to Elvis Presley|date=2016-12-19|work=The Sun|access-date=2017-11-24|language=en-GB}} and where the Beatles visited him in 1965. It was originally built by [[Howard Hughes]][http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/film/4609597.stm "Gabor dispute heads to courtroom"], ''BBC'', June 4, 2005. and featured a unique-looking [[Mansard roof|French style roof]].[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4048918/Inside-bizarre-Bel-Air-mansion-filled-self-portraits-horses-heads-Zsa-Zsa-Gabor-lived-four-decades-sold-11million-2013-condition-allowed-die-there.html "Zsa Zsa Gabor's lavish $11million Bel Air mansion where she died of a heart attack aged 99"], ''Daily Mail'', December 19, 2016. Gabor's only child, daughter [[Francesca Hilton|Constance Francesca Hilton]], was born on March 10, 1947.{{cite web|url=http://static2.nydailynews.com/polopoly_fs/1.2067583.1420571268!/img/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/article_970/zsa-zsa-daughter-1961.jpg|title=Photo of Zsa Zsa Gabor and daughter Francesca|publisher=}} According to Gabor's 1991 autobiography ''One Lifetime Is Not Enough'', her pregnancy resulted from [[rape]] by then-husband [[Conrad Hilton]]. She was the only [[Gabor sisters|Gabor sister]] who had a child. In 2005, a lawsuit was filed accusing her daughter of [[larceny]] and fraud, alleging that she had forged her signature to get a US$2 million loan on her mother's Bel Air house. However, the [[Los Angeles County Superior Court]], Santa Monica, threw out the case due to Gabor's failure to appear in court or to sign an [[affidavit]] that she indeed was a [[Plaintiff|co-plaintiff]] on the original lawsuit filed by her husband, Frédéric von Anhalt. Francesca Hilton died in 2015 at the age of 67 from a [[stroke]].{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/SHOWBIZ/celebrity.news.gossip/04/14/gabor.baby/index.html?hpt=T2|title=Zsa Zsa Gabor to become new mother at 94, husband says|first=Alan|last=Duke|publisher=CNN|date=April 19, 2011}}{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/people/2015/01/06/constance-francesa-hilton-zsa-zsa-gabor-daughter-dies/21327283|title=Francesa Hilton, Zsa Zsa Gabor's daughter, dies|work=USA Today|author=Oldeburg, Ann|date=January 6, 2015|accessdate=December 18, 2016}} Gabor's husband never told her about her daughter's death, out of concern for her physical and emotional state.{{cite web|url=http://dailynewshungary.com/zsa-zsa-gabor-i-want-to-die-in-hungary|title=Zsa Zsa Gabor: "I want to die in Hungary"|date=April 17, 2016|publisher=dailynewshungary.com}}{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/ZsaZsaGaborOfficial|title=Zsa Zsa Gabor - Facebook|publisher=facebook.com}} Gabor and her last husband, [[Frédéric Prinz von Anhalt]], adopted at least ten adult males who paid them a fee of up to $2,000,000 to become descendants by adoption of [[Princess Marie-Auguste of Anhalt]]. Prinz von Anhalt had paid Marie-Auguste to adopt him when he was 36 years old.{{cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/2007/SHOWBIZ/TV/02/14/annanicolesmith.prince.ap/index.html|title=Who is Prince Frederic von Anhalt? - CNN.com|date=March 3, 2007|work=archive.org|accessdate=December 21, 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070303114807/http://www.cnn.com/2007/SHOWBIZ/TV/02/14/annanicolesmith.prince.ap/index.html|archivedate=March 3, 2007|df=}} ===Legal and financial difficulties=== On June 14, 1989, in [[Beverly Hills, California]], Gabor was accused of slapping the face of Beverly Hills police officer Paul Kramer when he stopped her for a traffic violation at 8551 [[Olympic Boulevard (Los Angeles)|Olympic Boulevard]].[http://www.mugshots.net/zsa_zsa_gabor Profile], Mugshots.net {{webarchive| url=https://web.archive.org/web/20040603074355/http://www.mugshots.net/zsa_zsa_gabor| date=June 3, 2004}}; retrieved April 18, 2007 At trial three months later, a jury convicted her of slapping Kramer. They also found her guilty of driving without a license and possessing an open container of alcohol — a flask of [[Jack Daniel's]] — in her $215,000 [[Rolls-Royce]], but acquitted her of the charge of disobeying Kramer when she drove away from the traffic stop.{{cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/1989-09-30/news/mn-168_1_zsa-zsa-gabor|title='I Can't Believe It', She Says: Zsa Zsa Gabor Convicted of Slapping Police Officer|author=David Ferrell and Edmund Newton|website=Los Angeles Times|date=September 30, 1989|accessdate=April 25, 2016}} On October 25, 1989, Beverly Hills Municipal Judge Charles G. Rubin sentenced Gabor to serve three days in jail, to pay fines and restitution totaling $12,937, to perform 120 hours of community service, and to undergo a psychiatric evaluation.{{cite news|url=http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/1989-10-25/news/8902060273_1_zsa-zsa-gabor-ms-gabor-rubin|title=Beverly Hills Judge Slaps Zsa Zsa Gabor With 3 Days In Jail|website=Los Angeles Times|publisher=Sun-Sentinel|date=October 25, 1989|accessdate=April 25, 2016}} On June 14, 1990, Gabor dropped her conviction appeal and agreed to serve her sentence.{{cite news|url=http://articles.latimes.com/1990-06-14/local/me-284_1_zsa-zsa-gabor|title=Gabor to Give Up Appeal of Slapping Conviction|website=Los Angeles Times|date=June 14, 1990|accessdate=April 25, 2016}} However, she refused to take part in community service and served three days in jail from July 27 to July 30, 1990.[http://www.cnn.com/2013/02/17/us/zsa-zsa-gabor-fast-facts Zsa Zsa Gabor Fast Facts], CNN.com; accessed April 25, 2016. Gabor had a long-running feud with German-born actress [[Elke Sommer]] that began in 1984 when both appeared on ''[[Circus of the Stars]]'' and escalated into a multimillion-dollar [[libel]] suit by 1993. The suit resulted in an order for Gabor and her husband to pay Sommer $3.3 million in general and punitive damages.Pool, Bob. [http://articles.latimes.com/1993-12-09/local/me-50_1_gabor-sommer-feud "$3.3 million libel award in Sommer-Gabor Feud"], ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'', December 9, 1993; accessed January 15, 2011. On January 25, 2009, the [[Associated Press]] reported that her attorney stated that [[forensic accountant]]s determined that Gabor may have lost as much as $10 million [[Madoff investment scandal|invested in]] [[Bernard Madoff|Bernie Madoff's]] company, possibly through a third-party money manager.[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/us_and_americas/article5590788.ece "Gabor's Husband Says They Lost $10 Million Due to Madoff"], ''The Times Online'', January 26, 2009. ===Later life and health=== On November 27, 2002, Gabor was a front seat passenger in an automobile crash on [[Sunset Boulevard]], Los Angeles, from which she remained partially paralyzed and reliant on a wheelchair for mobility.{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/2002/11/29/zsa-zsa-gabor-seriously-hurt-after-car-crash.html|title=Zsa Zsa Gabor Seriously Hurt After Car Crash|date=29 November 2002|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.today.com/popculture/gabor-get-2-million-car-crash-wbna7093685|title=Gabor to get $2 million for car crash|publisher=}} She survived strokes in 2005 and 2007 and underwent surgeries. In 2010, she fractured her hip and underwent a successful hip replacement.{{cite news|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/gossip/2010/07/zsa-zsa-gabor-hip-replacement-surgery.html|title=Zsa Zsa Gabor hip surgery successful, her husband says|work=Los Angeles Times|date=July 19, 2010|accessdate=July 19, 2010}}{{cite news|url=http://content.usatoday.com/communities/entertainment/post/2010/07/zsa-zsa-gabor-hospitalized/1|title=Zsa Zsa Gabor hospitalized|work=USA Today|date=July 18, 2010|accessdate=July 18, 2010|first=Ann|last=Oldenburg}} In August 2010, Gabor was admitted to [[Ronald Reagan UCLA Medical Center]] in serious condition and received [[last rites]] from a Catholic priest.{{cite web|url=http://www.catholic.org/news/national/story.php?id=37848|title=Priest called to administer final rites to Zsa Zsa|author=Catholic Online|work=catholic.org}}{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2010/SHOWBIZ/celebrity.news.gossip/08/15/zsa.zsa.gabor.hospitalized|title=Zsa Zsa Gabor asks for 'last rites' from priest|work=cnn.com|date=August 15, 2010}} In 2011, her right leg was amputated above the knee to save her life from an infection.{{cite web|title=UCLA statement on Zsa Zsa Gabor’s condition following today's surgery|url=http://newsroom.ucla.edu/portal/ucla/ucla-statement-on-zsa-zsa-gabor-190931.aspx?link_page_rss=190931|publisher=UCLA Health Sciences Media Relations|accessdate=January 14, 2011}} She was hospitalized again in 2011 for a number of emergencies.{{cite news|title=Actress Zsa Zsa Gabor rushed to hospital again|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/SHOWBIZ/Movies/05/18/gabor.hospitalized/index.html?hpt=T2|publisher=CNN|accessdate=May 18, 2011|date=May 18, 2011}}{{cite news|title=Zsa Zsa Gabor is unresponsive, hospitalized, husband says|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/SHOWBIZ/celebrity.news.gossip/05/18/zsa.zsa.gabor.health/index.html?hpt=T2|publisher=CNN|accessdate=May 19, 2011|date=May 19, 2011}} On February 8, 2016, two days after her 99th birthday, Gabor was rushed to hospital after suffering from breathing difficulties. She was diagnosed with a feeding tube-related lung infection and was scheduled to undergo surgery to have her feeding tube removed.{{Cite news|url=http://nationalpost.com/entertainment/celebrity/zsa-zsa-gabor-rushed-to-emergency-room-two-days-after-99th-birthday|title=Zsa Zsa Gabor rushed to emergency room two days after 99th birthday|last=Ahsan|first=Sadaf|date=February 9, 2016|work=National Post|access-date=November 22, 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/zsa-zsa-gabor-rushed-hospital-breathing-issues-article-1.2525232|title=Zsa Zsa Gabor rushed to hospital for breathing issues|publisher=nydailynews.com|accessdate=July 27, 2016}} In April 2016, Gabor expressed her wish to move back to Hungary in 2017 and live out the rest of her life there. Her husband stated that he was determined to make her wish come true and he intended to arrange for "a big party in the summer" to celebrate the actress' 100th birthday, after which she would return to Budapest. ==Death== Gabor died at the age of 99 of cardiac arrest while in a coma at [[Ronald Reagan UCLA Medical Center]] on December 18, 2016, fifty days shy of becoming a [[centenarian]]. The causes of death were given as "Cardiopulmonary arrest, Coronary Artery Disease, and Cerebral Vascular Disease".{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/12/18/movies/zsa-zsa-gabor-often-married-actress-known-for-glamour-dies.html|title=Zsa Zsa Gabor, Actress Famous for Her Glamour (and Her Marriages), Dies at 99|last=McFadden|first=Robert D.|date=2016-12-18|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-11-24|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}} She had been on [[life support]] for the previous five years.{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2016/film/news/zsa-zsa-gabor-dead-dies-1201945003/|title=Hollywood Legend Zsa Zsa Gabor Dies at 99|author=Tim Gray|publisher=Variety|date=December 18, 2016|accessdate=December 18, 2016}} Her funeral was held on December 30 in a Catholic ceremony at the [[Church of the Good Shepherd (Beverly Hills, California)|Church of the Good Shepherd]] in Beverly Hills, where around 100 mourners attended.{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/people/2016/12/30/zsa-zsa-gabors-life-glamour-honored-at-funeral-mass/96009810/|title=Zsa Zsa Gabor honored at funeral mass|publisher=Associated Press/USA Today|date=December 30, 2016|accessdate=January 2, 2017}} Her ashes, placed in a gold rectangular box, were interred at the [[Westwood Village Memorial ===Plays=== Gabor occasionally appeared in theatre. From 1961 to 1970, she portrayed Elvira in national tours of ''[[Blithe Spirit (play)|Blithe Spirit]]''. In 1970, she made her [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] debut in ''[[Forty Carats]]''.{{Cite news |url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/entertainment/news/article.cfm?c_id=1501119&objectid=11769655 |title=Screen legend Zsa Zsa Gabor has died at the age of 99 |date=December 19, 2016 |newspaper=New Zealand Herald |language=en-NZ |issn=1170-0777 |access-date=December 19, 2016}} From 1971 to 1983, Gabor appeared in national tours of ''Forty Carats'', ''[[Bell, Book and Candle]]'', ''Blithe Spirit'', ''[[Arsenic and Old Lace (play)|Arsenic and Old Lace]]'' (with her sister, Eva), ''Finders Will Return'', and ''[[Ninotchka]]''.
